Trial_Design.evidence: This randomized cross‐over study compared the Trachway and the Airway Scope

Intervention.evidence: This randomized cross‐over study compared the Trachway and the Airway Scope

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the use of this system for tracheal intubation by novice operators.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome measure in both airway scenarios was the time required for a successful tracheal intubation.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Average intubation time did not differ significantly between the Trachway and Airway Scope for the normal airway scenario (11.2 ± 6.5 vs. 9.8 ± 4.3 seconds, respectively; p = 0.07), but was significantly longer using the Trachway than with the Airway Scope on the difficult airway scenario (17.1 ± 11.1 vs. 9.5 ± 4.1 seconds, respectively; p < 0.001).
